sen.e: TAIRA no Morikuni (1113-August 11, 1186) was a son of TAIRA no Morito (or according to a different opinion, TAIRA no Suehira).

sen.e: He was a member of the Taira clan; however, since he was a military officer of a collateral line, his official rank and social standing were rather low.

sen.e: He served as a close adviser of TAIRA no Kiyomori; during the Hogen War in 1156 and the Heiji War in 1159, he made many achievements as the core of Ichimonshu (clansman).

sen.e: When the Taira family was fading and was forced to leave the capital after Kiyomori's death, Morikuni followed suit.

sen.e: However, during the Battle of Dannoura in 1185, he was caught as a captive and sent to Kamakura along with TAIRA no Munemori.

sen.e: At the time, it seems that MINAMOTO no Yoritomo could not bring himself to kill aging Morikuni; instead of killing Morikuni, Yoritomo entrusted Yoshizane OKAZAKI with Morikuni.

sen.e: Later, Morikuni faced Hokke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra) day and night without uttering a word, refused food and drink and starved himself to death on July 25, 1186.
